Organs/Tissues: Human 2D epidermal layer (keratinocytes) innervated by iPSC-derived sensory neurons
Physiological/Pathological: Both – captures normal neuro-epidermal interactions (touch/pain/itch). Can induce irritation or inflammatory states
Cell Source: Primary human keratinocytes + human iPSC sensory neurons. No fibroblasts by default
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (epidermal + neuronal). Nerve fiber extension into skin compartment
Stromal Cells: No (not standard, no dermal fibroblasts included)
Circulating Immune: No (no vascular channel in this innervated variant)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, between sensory neurons and keratinocytes (neuron-skin crosstalk)
Air-Liquid Interface: Not typically (2D submerged culture). Potential ALI future step
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (surface coatings to support neuron and keratinocyte adhesion)
3D Scaffold: No, 2D compartments. Microchannels guide axons to skin layer
Notable Features: MEA-based neural readout possible, “pain/itch” signals from innervated skin. Good for neuro-dermatology studies
Plate/Format (Throughput): NeoBento plate with up to 16 chips. Each chip has 2 compartments (skin side, neuron side). Medium throughput
Max Culture Duration: 1–3 weeks. Enough for stable co-culture and repeated exposures
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (fluorescence to see neurites, keratinocyte morphology)
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, can measure secreted cytokines or neuropeptides
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Partial; typically in situ immunostaining. Manual retrieval complicated
Readouts - Whole Tissue: On-chip analysis mostly. Possibly fix entire device or carefully remove cells
Readouts - MEA: Optional (DuaLink MEA version) to record neuronal firing in real time
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Neurons themselves act as sensors. No embedded O2 or pH by default
Perfused: Static or minimal flow, no separate vascular channel in innervated model
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, localized drug application to skin or neuron side. MEA for live electrophysiology
model_availability: Product kit + device or R&D service from NETRI

Organs/Tissues: Human keratinocytes (skin epithelium) + microvascular endothelial cells. 2-chamber barrier
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Normal perfused skin barrier or inflamed/infected skin states. Tests transdermal absorption
Cell Source: Primary human keratinocytes (top), human endothelium (bottom). No fibroblasts by default
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (epidermal + endothelial). Potential immune introduction if desired
Stromal Cells: No standard fibroblasts, but user can add if needed
Circulating Immune: Yes, can flow immune cells through endothelial channel to model infiltration
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, epithelium–endothelium. “Irrigated skin” with real vascular-like flow
Air-Liquid Interface: Possible if user sets top channel to air flow. By default, 2D submerged culture
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, membrane or channel coated with ECM for cell adhesion
3D Scaffold: No standard, though the membrane is a 3D interface. Some future 3D skin expansions possible
Notable Features: Pump-free perfusion of endothelium. TEER measurement optional in collaboration with WPI. Ideal for transdermal drug studies
Plate/Format (Throughput): NeoBento system, up to 16 chips parallel. Medium throughput
Max Culture Duration: 1–3+ weeks with perfusion. Good for repeated dosing & barrier function tests
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (fluorescence, brightfield). Observe barrier formation, cell morphology
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, from flow outlet or top well to measure secreted factors or drug permeation
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible but tricky. Usually in situ analysis or chip cut open
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Chip-based imaging or partial membrane retrieval if carefully opened
Readouts - TEER: Yes if TEER electrodes are integrated (partnership with WPI). Monitors barrier integrity
Readouts - MEA: No standard for endothelium. Typically not relevant here
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in chemical sensors, can incorporate TEER electrodes
Perfused: Yes, endothelium side can be actively or passively perfused. Pump-free or optional external pump
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can modulate flow, add compounds, immune cells in real-time
model_availability: Product kit + device or service from NETRI

Organs/Tissues: Pure neuron-on-chip or co-culture with other peripheral cells (e.g. muscle, immune, gut). Focus on sensory or motor neurons
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Normal PNS function (axon growth, sensory detection) or neuropathies (CIPN, nerve injury)
Cell Source: Human iPSC-derived sensory or motor neurons. Optional co-cells (immune, fibroblasts) if user wants extended model
Multiple Cell Types: Yes or no. By default, pure neuronal networks. Additional cell types can be compartmentalized
Stromal Cells: Not standard. Possibly Schwann cells for advanced PNS myelination models
Tissue-resident Immune: Optional if user seeds them. Not standard
Circulating Immune: Possible if one channel is used to flow immune cells across neuronal compartment
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Often used for nerve–other organ crosstalk (like gut or muscle). Or purely nerve. Microchannels separate compartments
Air-Liquid Interface: No. Neurons fully submerged in microfluidic compartments
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (coating in channels for neurite extension). Typically laminin/collagen
3D Scaffold: Usually 2D neuronal compartments. Some 3D approach if user adds hydrogel for neurite embedding
Notable Features: Microchannel guidance of axons, functional readouts with MEA. Injury/regeneration studies. CIPN models
Plate/Format (Throughput): NeoBento multi-chip up to 16 units. Medium throughput for neuro assays
Max Culture Duration: 2–6 weeks. Neurons remain functional & form mature networks
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, confocal or widefield of neurite outgrowth. Calcium imaging possible
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes. Could measure secreted neurotrophins, etc.
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: In situ or destructive. Microchannel geometry can hamper cell harvest
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Not typical, mostly 2D neuronal networks on chip
Readouts - MEA: Yes, some devices have integrated MEA for real-time spike recordings
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: MEA electrodes. No O2/pH sensors by default
Perfused: Optional. Some run static, some incorporate slow flow or gradients
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can add toxins or growth factors to distal axons, separate from soma compartment
model_availability: NETRI PNS product line or custom R&D service

Organs/Tissues: Brain-related neuronal networks (cortical, hippocampal, or iPSC-derived), or 3D cerebral organoids under perfusion
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Normal neural circuits for excitatory/inhibitory balance, or disease states (epilepsy, neurodegeneration)
Cell Source: Human iPSC-derived excitatory/inhibitory neurons, astrocytes, or 3D brain organoids. Possibly integrated microglia or pericytes
Multiple Cell Types: Yes. E.g., excitatory and inhibitory neurons in separate compartments, or organoid with multiple cell lineages
Stromal Cells: Optional astrocytes, glia in organoid or co-culture. Pericytes in BBB context
Tissue-resident Immune: Optional microglia for neuroinflammation. Not standard
Circulating Immune: Possible if setting up perfused BBB with immune infiltration. Typically not default
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, if combining compartments for neuronal subtypes or linking neuron + vasculature. Also multi-chips for multi-region brain
Air-Liquid Interface: No. Neurons/brain organoids submerged or perfused in media
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, ECM coating in compartments. For organoids, internal ECM or Matrigel in the spheroid
3D Scaffold: Yes in organoid approach. Perfused cerebral organoid up to 60 days. Or 2D neuronal compartments for simpler setups
Notable Features: MEA-based electrophysiological recording, multi-compartment for distinct brain regions or cell types, perfused organoid option
Plate/Format (Throughput): NeoBento, up to 16 chips. Medium throughput. Each chip can hold 1–3 compartments
Max Culture Duration: Up to 60 days for perfused organoids. 2D neurons stable for weeks
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, neuronal morphology, calcium imaging, immunofluorescence
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes for neurotransmitters or cytokines in effluent
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible in organoid chip (removable). For 2D compartments, typically in situ analysis
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes for organoids (scaffold removal). 2D compartments rarely retrieved intact
Readouts - TEER: Yes if using BBB variant with electrodes. Not standard for basic neuron chips
Readouts - MEA: Yes, many NETRI CNS devices embed MEA under neuronal compartments
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: MEA electrodes. Possibly TEER in BBB. No chemical sensors by default
Dead Volume: Minimal in microchannels. Flow can be recirculating or single pass
Perfused: Yes, for organoids or BBB. Some simpler 2D neuron models are static or minimal flow
Gas Mix Controlled: Standard incubator. Optionally place entire system in specialized environment
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can vary flow, drug additions, neural stimulation. Record activity changes in real time
model_availability: NETRI CNS product line or custom service
